item.title: Lateline 22/09/11
item.description: Tony Jones hosts this edition which features stories on the Migration Act; the US's intention to veto a UN vote for Palestinian statehood, including an interview with Martin Indyk; revelatons of a former Rugby League captain about the head of the Church of Scientology; and global markets tumbling.

item.title: Lateline 21/09/11
item.description: Lateline is a unique nightly news analysis program bringing you up-to-the-minute coverage of Australian and international news and events.

item.title: Lateline 20/09/11
item.description: Ali Moore hosts this edition which features stories on Italy's credit rating downgrade; a review of security checks by Defence, including an interview with Stephen Smith; President Obama's debt reduction plan, including an interview with Michael Duffy of Time Magazine; and the trial of the man who killed Carl Williams.

item.title: Lateline 19/09/11
item.description: Ali Moore hosts this edition which features stories on the government's latest asylum seeker plan, including an interview with Scott Morrison; anti-nuclear protests in Tokyo; and a UN summit on food contents; plus an interview with British teacher and author, Katharine Birbalsingh.

item.title: Lateline 16/09/11
item.description: Lateline is a unique nightly news analysis program bringing you up-to-the-minute coverage of Australian and international news and events.

item.title: Lateline 15/09/11
item.description: Tony Jones hosts this edition which features stories on Federal politics including an interview with Malcolm Turnbull; former employees of the Church of Scientology planning a class action; David Cameron and Nicolas Sarkozy arriving in Tripoli; and soldiers in Afghanistan trying to establish a relationship with locals.

item.title: Lateline 14/09/11
item.description: Tony Jones hosts this edition which features stories on the carbon tax debate, including an interview with Bob Brown; a 20 hour seige in Kabul; Ian Dempsey denying he raped John Hepworth; and proposed changes to Victoria's double jeopardy laws.

item.title: Lateline 13/09/11
item.description: Ali Moore hosts this edition which features stories on the Government's carbon tax including an interview with Greg Combet; the Church of Scientology may have to pay millions of dollars in back pay to staff; Nick Xenophon naming a priest at the centre of a sex abuse scandal; Libya's new leaders promising moderate Islamic rule; and a Taliban attack in Kabul.

item.title: Lateline 12/09/11
item.description: Ali Moore hosts this edition which features stories on the government's intention to change the law to allow off shore processing of asylum seekers including an interview with Chris Bowen; Former escort Natalie Row talks about the scandal involving drugs and the British Chancellor; and Samantha Stosur's victory in the US Open.

item.title: Lateline 09/09/11
item.description: Ali Moore presents this edition which features stories on asylum seeker policy; President Obama's jobs plan; China looking to Australia for tips on how to reduce carbon emissions; and the start of the Rugby World Cup; plus an interview with terrorism expert Michael Scheuer.

item.title: Lateline Business 22/09/2011
item.description: Lateline Business is a comprehensive look at the financial and economic news of the day. The program has feature interviews with business leaders, as well as updates on stockmarkets here and abroad.

item.title: Lateline Business 21/09/2011
item.description: Lateline Business is a comprehensive look at the financial and economic news of the day. The program has feature interviews with business leaders, as well as updates on stockmarkets here and abroad.

item.title: The Next Big Thing Episode 4
item.description: The fledgling suppliers face the harsh realities of the world of retail. The open days are over but the hard work is only just beginning.

item.title: The Next Big Thing Episode 3
item.description: Home retail giant Habitat hosts its open day. Home retail is a crowded market, so the store's head of range and creative director will be ruthless in their decision making.

item.title: Crownies Episode 12
item.description: Janet and Lina wrestle with a potential child sociopath; Richard crosses the line with a key witness; and Tatum discovers that running her own case is perplexing. CAST: Marta Dusseldorp, Andrea Demetriades, Indiana Evans

item.title: Crownies Episode 11
item.description: Relations between Rhys and Erin are more strained than ever; Lina takes on a disturbing case where a boy has killed his younger brother; and Richard solves Conrad's romantic problems. CAST: Jerome Ehlers, Ella Scott Lynch

item.title: Crownies Episode 10
item.description: Erin's finding it increasingly hard to keep working on a brutal murder case; Janet has pregnancy complications; and David makes a decision about the Attorney General file. CAST: Ella Scott Lynch, Marta Dusseldorp

item.title: Crownies Episode 9
item.description: Lina works a drugs case involving an undercover cop; Erin deals with a bizarre mistaken identity rape case; and Richard succumbs to the charms of an older woman. CAST: Andrea Demetriades; Ella Scott Lynch, Hamish Michael

item.title: Catalyst Episode 31
item.description: The 3D printing revolution; ocean waves on the rise; recovered memories - are they reliable?; which falls faster - medicine balls or basketballs?; and the Mexican wave - penguin style!

item.title: Catalyst Episode 30
item.description: Reflections of an astronaut; re-inventing the guitar; germinating new life - with cyanide!; honey bee aerobatics; and natural poison.

item.title: Restoration Man Episode 8 Coach House
item.description: Restoring an 18th century coach house in East Sussex to a two-bedroom dwelling, a couple meet with unexpected obstacles that put pressure on their marriage.

item.title: Restoration Man Episode 7 Ice House
item.description: A canny Scot wants to turn his 'stone fridge' ice house at the side of a Scottish loch into an idyllic hideaway, but red tape throws a spanner in the works.

item.title: Elephant Nomads of the Namib Desert
item.description: The population of desert-dwelling elephants was dramatically cut during the 1980s to just a handful. Now these elephants are struggling to overcome the odds and keep their babies alive in an unforgiving environment.

item.title: At The Movies Episode 33
item.description: Margaret and David review Johnny English Reborn; Monte Carlo; Tabloid; Snow Flower And The Secret Fan; Cave Of Forgotten Dreams, and David reviews the DVD Classic: Went The Day Well?

item.title: At The Movies Episode 32
item.description: This week Margaret and David report from the Venice Film Festival. They will discuss films they've seen at the festival and screen interviews with stars and directors whose films are showing at the festival.

item.title: At Home With Julia Episode 3 The Leaker
item.description: Julia and Tim plan a big announcement at Tim's birthday but have a catastrophic misunderstanding over what it is. Julia is also convinced Rudd's been leaking. CAST: Amanda Bishop, Phil Lloyd

item.title: At Home With Julia Episode 2
item.description: When Julia accidentally locks herself in The Lodge bathroom and fails to show at Tim's hairdressing event, security are convinced she's been snatched by terrorists. CAST: Amanda Bishop, Phil Lloyd

item.title: At Home With Julia Episode 1
item.description: Julia's plans for a seductive date night in with Tim are somewhat compromised when Independent MPs Rob Oakeshott, Bob Katter and Tony Windsor crash the event. CAST: Amanda Bishop, Phil Lloyd

item.title: The Gruen Transfer Episode 8
item.description: The Gruen team looks at sports betting advertisements, the Pitch tries to sell that Australian Politicians are underpaid and in Ad Crunch the team discusses the implications of digital video recording and digital manipulations

item.title: The Gruen Transfer Episode 7
item.description: The Gruen team looks at shampoo and hair conditioner advertisements, the Pitch tries to convince people to privatise ABC and in Ad Crunch the team discusses the latest Doritos ad which fuses videogames and cinema trailers ideas.

item.title: The Gruen Transfer: Inside The Pitch Inside The Pitch: Redhanded
item.description: Behind the scenes with agency Redhanded and the making of their Pitch.

item.title: The Gruen Transfer: Inside The Pitch Inside The Pitch: Fenton Stephens
item.description: Behind the scenes with agency Fenton Stephens and the making of their Pitch.

item.title: The Gruen Transfer: Inside The Pitch Inside The Pitch: Loud
item.description: Behind the scenes with agency Loud and the making of their Pitch.

item.title: The Gruen Transfer: Inside The Pitch Inside The Pitch: JMK
item.description: Behind the scenes with agency JMK and the making of their Pitch.

item.title: The Gruen Transfer: Inside The Pitch Inside The Pitch: Play
item.description: Behind the scenes with agency Play and the making of their Pitch.

item.title: The Gruen Transfer: Inside The Pitch Inside The Pitch: Loud And Clear
item.description: Behind the scenes with agency Loud and Clear and the making of their Pitch.

item.title: Spicks And Specks Episode 20
item.description: Joining Adam, Alan and Myf are actress and singer Jane Clifton, comedian Lawrence Mooney, Parkway Drive front-man Winston McCall, and comedian Peter Helliar. Mick Stuart closes the show.

item.title: Spicks And Specks Episode 19
item.description: The world of music exposed like never before. Comedian Adam Hills leads two teams through different rounds of music-related riddles and games.

item.title: Poh's Kitchen On The Road Episode 5
item.description: Poh's on the road to the Australian alps. Recently Poh has been using beer as an ingredient instead of wine to give an extra bit of sweetness and complexity. So she's off to visit a charming boutique brewery near Bright.

item.title: Poh's Kitchen On The Road Episode 4
item.description: Poh's on the road to Port Willunga on SA's Fleurieu Peninsula to attend the 'One Magic Bowl', an event where eleven local chefs are creating eleven seafood dishes to be served in one bespoke bowl on the beach.

item.title: Country House Rescue Episode 3 Chesters, Scottish Borders
item.description: Ruth visits Chesters, a 215-year-old house belonging to John and Ellie Henderson. The Grade I-listed Georgian country home was inherited by John, but he now lives 360 miles away in London.

item.title: Country House Rescue Episode 2 Elmore Court, Gloucestershire
item.description: Successful UK businesswoman Ruth Watson advises a 36 year old DJ on how to increase revenue from his unique stately British home, to ensure it can be enjoyed for generations to come.

item.title: Big Ideas Episode 66
item.description: In his keynote address at the recent Byron Bay Writer's Festival, John Pilger takes aim at Australian and world political leaders and claims Australia has become a satellite state of America.

item.title: Big Ideas Episode 65
item.description: Joanna Murray Smith discusses the life of a playwright; Gillian Armstrong and Paul Cox take a cynical look at Hollywood; Malcolm Knox talks about surfing and writing and a sneak preview of the Keynote Address.

item.title: Big Ideas Episode 64
item.description: Critic, writer and Professor of Journalism at New York University, Jay Rosen is an internationally renowned media commentator who thinks political coverage worldwide has gone down the tube.

item.title: Big Ideas Episode 63
item.description: Ian Morris on 'Why the West Rules for Now'; Jay Rosen explains 'Why Political Coverage is Broken'; William Powers argues that making the most of our digital technologies might mean using them less; and more!

item.title: Artscape 2011 3 Days in Venice: Biennale 2011
item.description: The Venice Biennale is one of the world's largest and most prestigious arts events. This is a focus on glamorous international art, celebrity parties, competitive national exhibitions and behind-the-scenes nerves.

item.title: Artscape 2011 Memory Play
item.description: Helen Morse takes the lead in Sundowner a play about a mother coping with Alzheimer's disease. Morse's mother suffered with Alzheimer's and this play proves both traumatic and cathartic.

item.title: Foreign Correspondent 20/09/2011
item.description: What would happen if people around the world, concerned about the plight of Palestinians all stopped buying Israeli products and ceased using Israeli services? Would it alter the course of events, succeed where so many peace proposals, special envoys, intense diplomacy and armed conflict have failed? We go behind the global grassroots campaign railing against Israel with boycotts.

item.title: Foreign Correspondent 13/09/2011
item.description: In the shadow of a giant nuclear power plant a determined woman refuses to budge from her little wooden shack. She's not going to let the powerful nuclear company take her family home - no matter how many millions of dollars they wave at her.

item.title: Foreign Correspondent 6/09/2011
item.description: He compares Islam to communism and fascism, the Koran to Mein Kampf, and he holds the balance of power in The Netherlands. Geert Wilders is Europe's incendiary Stop-and-Go-Back man and he won't rest until he kills multiculturalism stone dead.

item.title: Foreign Correspondent 30/08/2011
item.description: In the years following WW2, the movie studios of Ealing produced comedies and rousing dramas which defined the Brits as mannered, enterprising, stoic and quick-witted. Then, one night recently, Ealing produced something very different- a shocking, real-life horror show. The quiet, comfortable suburb was suddenly under siege from hoards of rampaging hoodies.

item.title: Fake or Fortune? Episode 4 (Final) : Rembrandt
item.description: Art expert Philip Mould believes he may have spotted a 'sleeper', an important picture that has been miscatalogued and offered for a very low price.

item.title: Fake or Fortune? Episode 3 Van Meergeren
item.description: Journalist Fiona Bruce teams up with art expert Philip Mould to investigate mysteries behind paintings. The duo investigates a painting by the world's most famous forgers - Han Van Meegeren.

item.title: Lost Gardens Episode 2 Shelley
item.description: Monty Don and his garden restoration team unearth the moated Tudor garden at Shelley Hall, Suffolk, created in 1519 by Sir Philip Tilney.

item.title: Meerkat Manor Episode 6 Sibling Rivalry
item.description: The Zappa gang wake to find their dominant female, Lola, is missing. When she returns, her sister, Punk, seizes power and transforms the Zappa into a formidable force capable of taking on the under-strength Whiskers.

item.title: Meerkat Manor Episode 5 The Tale Of Ren And Stumpy
item.description: Rocket Dog is left with the difficult task of leading the group after Flower's mysterious disappearance. But things go from bad to worse when roving males from the Zappa turn up and the pups fall victim to the desert.

item.title: Behind The News BtN 20/09/11
item.description: Behind the News is a high-energy fun way for upper primary and secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world.

item.title: Behind The News BtN 13/09/11
item.description: Behind the News is a high-energy fun way for upper primary and secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world.

item.title: Brideshead Revisited Episode 10 A Twitch Upon A Thread
item.description: Charles and Julia resolve to speed up their respective divorces and marry as soon as possible. Cordelia makes an unexpected return from Spain, bringing disturbing news about Sebastian. CAST: Anthony Andrews, Jeremy Irons

item.title: Australian Story 19/09/11
item.description: The Courage Of Her Convictions: When Catherine Smith was found not guilty of attempting to murder her own husband it was a turning point in one of the most extraordinary cases in Australian criminal history.

item.title: Australian Story 12/09/11
item.description: Brand New Day: Forty-one year old Gavin Larkin was the ultimate alpha male with a seemingly perfect life.

item.title: Australian Story 05/09/11
item.description: Paint The Town Black: Not since the mighty Phar Lap has a horse captured the public imagination like Black Caviar. She remains unbeaten after thirteen runs and has been declared the best racehorse in the world.

item.title: Australian Story 30/08/11 : David Hicks Special
item.description: The story of controversial former Guantanamo Bay detainee David Hicks.

item.title: Australian Story 29/08/11
item.description: Australian Story aims to present a varied and contrasting picture of contemporary Australia and Australians from many different perspectives and to contribute to the wider spectrum of coverage of issues and individuals.

item.title: Four Corners 19/09/11 : The Carbon War
item.description: The Carbon War: Four Corners examines the campaign being waged against the Federal Government over climate change policy that will put a price on Australia's greenhouse gas emissions for the first time.

item.title: Four Corners 12/09/11 : Own Goal
item.description: Own Goal: The story behind Australia's failed bid to host the World Cup and the impact it's having on the "beautiful game".

item.title: Four Corners 05/09/11 : In Their Sights
item.description: In Their Sights: The story behind the controversial strategy Coalition forces are using in Afghanistan to kill or capture the Taliban leadership.

item.title: Four Corners 29/08/11 : Bad News
item.description: Bad News: An investigation into the scandal that threatens to destroy Rupert Murdoch's British media empire. Sarah Ferguson reports.

item.title: Four Corners 22/08/11 : Fifty Years of Four Corners
item.description: Fifty Years of Four Corners: The Four Corners 50th Anniversary show, tracing the history of the program.

item.title: Q&A Episode 32
item.description: Host Tony Jones is joined by Former NSW Premier, Kristina Keneally; author and philosopher, Raymond Gaita; video blogger and atheist, Cristina Rad; and Australian Christian Lobby Director, Jim Wallace.

item.title: Q&A Episode 31
item.description: Host Tony Jones is joined by feminist, Germaine Greer; MP, Barnaby Joyce; journalist, Paul Barry; Social Commentator, Melinda Tankard Reist and writer, Joe Hildebrand.

item.title: Media Watch 2011 Episode 32
item.description: Australia's leading forum for media analysis and comment, presented by Jonathan Holmes.

item.title: Media Watch 2011 Episode 31
item.description: Australia's leading forum for media analysis and comment, presented by Jonathan Holmes.

item.title: Outnumbered Episode 4
item.description: Ben's fibbing goes to a whole new level and a romantic night in for mum and dad doesn't quite go to plan. CAST: Claire Skinner

item.title: Outnumbered Episode 3
item.description: Stuck on the A3, Mum tries to keep the peace in a car containing a new-age Auntie, a bewildered Grandfather, three fractious kids and several full bladders. CAST: Claire Skinner

item.title: Mrs Carey's Concert
item.description: At a girls' high school, music director Karen Carey prepares her young students for a concert at the Opera House. Mrs Carey inspires many of her girls, but some do not share her passion and are not afraid to say so.

item.title: Cheese Slices Episode 7 Cyprus
item.description: Will travels to Cyprus to see how traditional Haloumi is still made. He visits one of the last farm producers still making Haloumi the old fashioned way, then checks out some unusual ways to cook this delicious cheese.

item.title: Cheese Slices Episode 6 Wisconsin
item.description: Will meets Willi Lehner to see how he ripens cheese in an underground cave. He then heads to Hidden Springs Creamery, where a new organic ewe's milk cheese is being made with the help of local Amish farmers.

item.title: Backyard Science Episode 1
item.description: No Bunsen burners or laboratories here, this is science for everybody, anywhere. Wherever the kids want to take it; in the garden, in the kitchen or in the shed, this is science BY kids FOR kids!

item.title: Backyard Science Episode 26 (Final)
item.description: No Bunsen burners or laboratories here, this is science for everybody, anywhere. Wherever the kids want to take it; in the garden, in the kitchen or in the shed, this is science BY kids FOR kids!

item.title: Backyard Science Episode 25
item.description: No Bunsen burners or laboratories here, this is science for everybody, anywhere. Wherever the kids want to take it; in the garden, in the kitchen or in the shed, this is science BY kids FOR kids!

item.title: Backyard Science Episode 24
item.description: No Bunsen burners or laboratories here, this is science for everybody, anywhere. Wherever the kids want to take it; in the garden, in the kitchen or in the shed, this is science BY kids FOR kids!

item.title: Elaine Paige Live At The State Theatre
item.description: Recorded in front of a live audience at the State Theatre in October 2009, Elaine Page sings a selection of songs from the musicals she has appeared in during her 40 year career.

item.title: Compass Episode 32 My Brother The Islamist
item.description: What turns an ordinary man into an extremist? Robb is an ordinary white middle-class English boy. So too is his stepbrother Rich, but when Rich became a radical Islamist, Robb wants to find out about his brother's new life.

item.title: Compass Episode 31 9/11 Ten Years On
item.description: Compass examines the deep and enduring social, religious and cultural implications of 9/11 from an Australian perspective through the eyes of those directly affected.

item.title: Dancing King: Man In The Mirror Episode 3 Post Watershed
item.description: Stage musical genius David King delays rehearsals for the Michael Jackson homage show and orders new auditions for a young Michael and the lead female singer.

item.title: Dancing King: Man In The Mirror Episode 2
item.description: British stage musical maestro David King flies to New York to audition for the right look and sound for his homage to Michael Jackson, but the talent is disappointing, until...

item.title: Grand Designs Revisited Episode 4 The Lot - France
item.description: Kevin McCloud returns to the Lot region of France to see if a couple's ecological, straw bale house has fulfilled its brief, and helped them integrate into French life.

item.title: Grand Designs Revisited Episode 3 Belfast
item.description: Kevin McCloud goes back to Belfast to check out one of the biggest Grand Designs of them all!

item.title: Life Episode 1
item.description: This 10-part natural history blockbuster, shot in HD, is the definitive exploration of the diversity of life on Earth, revealing the most spectacular and extreme behaviour driven by the endless struggle to survive.

item.title: Art Nation Episode 31
item.description: Fenella Kernebone visits the first major retrospective in 25 years of Fred Williams - one of Australia's greatest painters. Some rarely seen landscapes and some lesser known fascinating waterscapes and portraits are revealed.

item.title: Art Nation Episode 30
item.description: Fenella Kernebone goes to GOMA in Brisbane to discover one of the 21st century's most influential photography masters, Henri Cartier-Bresson.

item.title: The SANFL 2011 Qualifying Final
item.description: Norwood Vs Eagles

item.title: The SANFL 2011 Elimination Final
item.description: Glenelg Vs South

item.title: Rugby Union: Shute Shield 2011 Preliminary Final 2
item.description: Sydney University Vs Manly

item.title: Rugby Union: Shute Shield 2011 Preliminary Final 1
item.description: Eastwood Vs Randwick

item.title: Rugby Union: Shute Shield 2011 Rugby Union: Shute Shield Semi Final 2
item.description: Coverage of the NSW Rugby Union Shute Shield.

item.title: Rugby Union: Shute Shield 2011 Rugby Union: Shute Shield Semi Final 1
item.description: Coverage of the NSW Rugby Union Shute Shield.

item.title: VFL Football 2011 Preliminary Final 2
item.description: Williamstown Vs Werribee

item.title: VFL Football 2011 Preliminary Final 1
item.description: Port Melbourne Vs Northern Bullants

item.title: Message Stick Episode 9 Back To Waiben
item.description: Message Stick's intrepid I.T. guru, Majhid Heath visits the beautiful Thursday Island for the 12th National Remote Indigenous Media Festival and the Torres Strait Island Media Association's 25th Anniversary.

item.title: Message Stick Episode 8 Eight Ladies
item.description: Journey through Alyawarr Country with eight ladies as they hunt echidna and gather bush tucker.

item.title: Insiders 18/09/11
item.description: Insiders, presented by Barrie Cassidy, is a fast-moving treatment of national affairs with interviews, discussion, and analysis. Each week the program brings together the experience and insights of leading political commentators and other contributors representing a wide range of opinions.

item.title: Insiders 11/09/11
item.description: Insiders, presented by Barrie Cassidy, is a fast-moving treatment of national affairs with interviews, discussion, and analysis. Each week the program brings together the experience and insights of leading political commentators and other contributors representing a wide range of opinions.

item.title: Landline 18/09/11
item.description: On Landline this week the spirited debate over roll bars for quad bikes, Pacific Island pickers lending a hand in the Australian citrus harvest and rugby proves it's a force for good in a farming community that's taken its share of hard knocks this year.

item.title: Landline 11/09/11
item.description: On Landline this week we look at a bright idea to encourage graduate teachers to work in the bush. It's a bumper season for citrus growers but the high dollar is making it hard to sell and resilience on the Rangelands as graziers gather at Boulia to take stock.

item.title: Landline 04/09/11
item.description: Every year for the past 30, some of the best musicians in the country and their fans have made the pilgrimage to the Amamoor State Forest in Queensland's south-east for the Gympie Music Muster. In this special edition of Landline we'll bring you some of the highlights of the biggest not-for-profit event of its kind in the country.

item.title: Landline 28/08/2011
item.description: On Landline this week, Japanese farmers and fishing industry on the slow path to recovery after the devastating tsunami and nuclear meltdown, laying down the law for farm animals and the case for and against wild horses in the Kosciuszko National Park.

item.title: Offsiders 18/09/11
item.description: A show for anyone who's serious about sport, Offsiders will provide challenging, insightful, humourous debate about the topic that dominates weekends - sport. Each week the program brings together the experience and insights of leading sporting commentators and other contributors representing a wide range of opinions.

item.title: Inside Business 18/09/11
item.description: Alan Kohler with analysis and comment on the events and issues concerning business, investors and entrepreneurs.

item.title: Inside Business 11/09/11
item.description: Alan Kohler with analysis and comment on the events and issues concerning business, investors and entrepreneurs.

item.title: Oliver Twist Episode 1
item.description: A gripping and emotionally powerful two-part adaptation of 'Oliver Twist' by one of British television's most exciting writers, Sarah Phelps, breathes new life into this much loved classic. CAST: William Miller, Adam Arnold

item.title: Monroe Episode 3
item.description: Monroe comes under pressure when he takes a 'wait and see' approach to a patient with a blood clot on his brain. Will his decision be the right one? CAST: James Nesbitt, Susan Lynch

item.title: Monroe Episode 2
item.description: Struggling to accept that his wife has left him, Monroe throws himself into work at the hospital, with a double shooting to deal with. CAST: James Nesbitt, Susan Lynch

item.title: Doctor Who: Confidential Cutdown Series Six Part 2 Episode 10
item.description: Amy is trapped in a quarantine facility for victims of an alien plague - a plague that will kill the Doctor in a day. The Doctor can use the TARDIS to smash through time and break in, but then Rory is on his own.

item.title: Doctor Who: Confidential Cutdown Series Six Part 2 Episode 9
item.description: Specially filmed as a companion piece to Doctor Who. Includes behind-the-scenes action from the latest series of the popular family drama.

item.title: The Wild Gourmets In Spain Episode 2
item.description: Tommi and Guy Grieve head for the dry central plains of Castille. This is Don Quixote country where they track down wild boar, help harvest the world's rarest spice - saffron, and encounter an opinionated shepherd.

item.title: The Wild Gourmets In Spain Episode 1
item.description: Masterchef winner, author and cook Tommi Miers returns to bring the very best of Spanish cuisine to the table.

item.title: Doctor Who Series Six Part 2 Episode 10
Doctor Who Series Six Part 2 Episode 9
item.description: The Doctor receives a distress call from the scariest place in the Universe. A child's bedroom. Terrified of the monsters in his cupboard, George's pleas for help break through the barriers of all time and space. CAST: Matt Smith

item.title: Gardening Australia Episode 32
item.description: Jane Edmanson visits comedian and musician Rusty Berther to help him prepare for the competitive marrow growing season; Clarence Slockee looks at some rare and threatened plants; Tino Carnevale plants spring crops; and more!

item.title: Gardening Australia Episode 31
item.description: Jane Edmanson returns to see how novice gardener and comedian Dave Lawson has got along with his garden since her last visit; Jerry Coleby-Williams is in his vegie garden; and more!

item.title: Beautiful People Episode 5 How I Got My Turner
item.description: The Doonans go deep into the world of Brit Art when they meet rabble rouser Stacey Bile. Meanwhile, Aunty Hayley has set herself up as a telephone astrologer with one rather obsessive client. CAST: Luke Ward-Wilkinson

item.title: Beautiful People Episode 4 How I Got My Camp
item.description: Simon Doonan now works in a big London store. A question from his assistant prompts memories of the time when it looked like the family Doonan were set for their first foreign holiday. CAST: Luke Ward-Wilkinson

item.title: Silent Witness Episode 10 The Prodigal: Part 2 (Final)
item.description: As Sabiston works through the post-mortems, Harry notices evidence of extensive plastic surgery on the body of the dead bodyguard and starts to suspect dirty tricks. CAST: William Gaminara, Emilia Fox, Tom Ward

item.title: Silent Witness Episode 9 The Prodigal: Part 1
item.description: After a major incident at the Dutch Embassy, Harry and Nikki are removed from the case when the Dutch decide to appoint their own pathologist. CAST: William Gaminara, Tom Ward, Emilia Fox

item.title: Collectors Episode 20
item.description: The team immerses themselves in art. Hobart's MONA, the Museum of Old and Modern Art, is unlike any other art gallery or museum in the world. Owned by David Walsh it is the largest private art gallery in Australia.

item.title: Collectors Episode 19
item.description: Canberra shines with incredible collections of Australian children's books, historic keyboards and Ballets Russes costumes, which is a fine contrast to David Whyte's trade tools and Jake Smith's royal menus.

item.title: Bill's Tasty Weekends Episode 7 Derbyshire
item.description: Bill is swapping his urban life for a weekend of country pursuits. Staying at a hunting lodge on the magnificent Chatsworth Estate, he tries clay pigeon shooting and falconry, and also makes a delicious lunch using pheasant.

item.title: Bill's Tasty Weekends Episode 6 Isle Of Wight
item.description: Bill takes his three daughters to England's largest island - the Isle of Wight. The Isle also has the reputation of being the most haunted island in the world, so Bill has to create a spooky feast.

item.title: Midsomer Murders Episode 2
item.description: Midsomer Murders S6 - More murders and mysteries in the quintessential English countryside, based on the award winning Inspector Barnaby novels by mystery writer Caroline Graham whom the Sunday Times described as 'the best detective writer since Agatha Christie'.

item.title: Midsomer Murders Episode 1 A Talent For Life
item.description: The murder of a glamorous and feisty former socialite uncovers a series of illicit affairs between prominent Malham Bridge residents. CAST: John Nettles, Daniel Casey

item.title: Invasion of the Crocodiles
item.description: From hundreds of miles out at sea to remote lakes, Australia's saltwater crocodiles are appearing in places never seen before, and with devastating effects.

item.title: QI Episode 8 Hypothetical
item.description: It's a QI first - a quiz show with no answers. Stephen Fry departs from the certainties of everyday life to explore the realm of 'hypothetical' questions with panellists Alan Davies, John Lloyd, Sandi Toksvig and Johnny Vegas.

item.title: 9/11 Remembered
item.description: Highlights from ABCs coverage of the 10th anniversary of 9/11.

item.title: The World - The 9/11 Decade The 9/11 Decade
item.description: A look back at events at home and abroad in the decade since 9/11. Hosted by Kim Landers with live reporting from Scott Bevan, Craig McMurtrie, Sally Sara and international guests.

item.title: Soldiers Of Peace
item.description: Are we outgrowing war? This film traverses the globe to meet drivers of peace in our time - individuals who are making a difference. Narrated by actor Michael Douglas.

item.title: Stones In Exile
item.description: An amazing film which captures the creation of the Rolling Stones classic rock album... and the drink, drugs and scandal that went with it.

item.title: Rebirth
item.description: How does the journey of grieving and recovery unfold for individuals and a nation? This program chronicles the lives of five people profoundly affected by the 9/11 attacks.

item.title: Robin Hood Episode 13 Something Worth Fighting For: Part 2 (Final)
item.description: War breaks out in Nottingham as the Sheriff attacks with everything he has. Finally it comes down to the feared few: Robin, Gisborne, Isabella and the Sheriff. CAST: Clive Standen

item.title: Whale Shark
item.description: The whale shark is the largest fish in the ocean but scientifically very little is known about them. Join Australian marine biologist Mark Meekan as he tracks this elusive fish over a year.

item.title: Doctor Who Episode 13 Journey's End (Final)
item.description: The entire universe is in danger as the Daleks activate their masterplan. CAST: David Tennant, Catherine Tate, Billie Piper, Freema Agyeman

item.title: Rake Episode 8 (Final)
item.description: Cleaver defends Mick Corella on a murder charge; and David finds out about Missy's past. CAST: Richard Roxburgh, Matt Day, Adrienne Pickering, Russell Dykstra, Danielle Cormack, Caroline Brazier
